instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How does a constant speed pump operate?
output: A constant speed pump will run regardless of whether or not there is a load. If it operates continuously it may add heat to the loop if no equipment is turned on. If it operates intermittently it will run if a load is sensed and shut off if there is no load.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is a variable speed pump defined?
output: A variable speed pump is defined with maximum and minimum flow rates that are the physical limits of the device.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if there is no load on the loop and the pump is operating intermittently?
output: If there is no load on the loop and the pump is operating intermittently then the pump can shutdown.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How does a variable speed pump operate under different loading conditions?
output: For any condition such as the loop having a load and the pump operating intermittently or continuously the pump will operate and select a flow between the minimum and maximum limits to meet the flow request made by demand side components.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the rated head of the primary chilled water pump?
output: The rated head of the primary chilled water pump is 179352 Pa which is equivalent to 60 feet H2O.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the field for the rated head of the secondary chilled water pump?
output: Field: Secondary Chilled Water Pump Rated Head.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the chilled water pump configuration?
output: The default value is ConstantPrimaryNoSecondary.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How does a constant speed pump operate?
output: The operation of a constant speed pump is straightforward. If operating continuously it runs regardless of a load potentially adding heat to the loop if no equipment is on. If intermittent it runs if a load is sensed and shuts off if there is no load.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the operational characteristics of a variable speed pump?
output: A variable speed pump has maximum and minimum flow rates as physical limits. It can shut down if there's no load and it's operating intermittently. Otherwise it operates between the limits to meet flow requests by demand side components.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the rated head of the primary chilled water pump?
output: The rated head of the primary chilled water pump is 179352 Pa equivalent to 60 feet H2O.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the rated head of the secondary chilled water pump?
output: The rated head of the secondary chilled water pump is 179352 Pa equivalent to 60 feet H2O.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the secondary chilled water pump rated head applicable?
output: This field is applicable only if the Chilled Water Pump Configuration is Constant Primary Variable Secondary or Variable Primary Constant Secondary.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Chilled Water Load Distribution Scheme' field select?
output: The Load Distribution Scheme selects the algorithm used to sequence equipment operation in order to meet the plant loop demand.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How many schemes are functional for 'Chilled Water Load Distribution Scheme'?
output: Currently five schemes are functional.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Optimal' scheme do in the 'Chilled Water Load Distribution Scheme'?
output: Optimal operates each piece of equipment at its optimal part load ratio and will operate the last component between its minimum and maximum part load ratio in order to meet the loop demand.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'SequentialLoad' scheme do in the 'Chilled Water Load Distribution Scheme'?
output: SequentialLoad loads each piece of equipment sequentially in the order specified in the PlantEquipmentList to its maximum part load ratio and will operate the last required piece of equipment between its minimum and maximum part load ratio in order to meet the loop demand.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'UniformLoad' scheme do in the 'Chilled Water Load Distribution Scheme'?
output: UniformLoad evenly distributes the loop demand among all available components on the equipment list for a given load range.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'SequentialUniformPLR' scheme do in the 'Chilled Water Load Distribution Scheme'?
output: SequentialUniformPLR loads all equipment on the PlantEquipmentList to a uniform part load ratio (PLR). Components are loaded sequentially based on the order specified in the PlantEquipmentList until each.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the function of the 'UniformLoad' scheme in the 'Field: Chilled Water Load Distribution Scheme'?
output: The 'UniformLoad' scheme evenly distributes the loop demand among all available components on the equipment list for a given load range.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How does the 'SequentialUniformPLR' scheme work in the 'Field: Chilled Water Load Distribution Scheme'?
output: The 'SequentialUniformPLR' scheme loads all equipment on the PlantEquipmentList to a uniform part load ratio (PLR). Components are loaded sequentially based on the order specified in the PlantEquipmentList until each component is fully loaded at which point the next subsequent component is added and the load is distributed uniformly based on PLR between the components.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'UniformPLR' scheme ensure in the 'Field: Chilled Water Load Distribution Scheme'?
output: The 'UniformPLR' scheme will load all equipment on the PlantEquipmentList to a uniform part load ratio (PLR). No equipment will be loaded below its minimum PLR. If the total load is less than the sum of all equipment on the PlantEquipmentList operating at their respective minimum PLRs then the last item in the equipment list is dropped and the load is distributed based on a uniform PLR for the remaining plant equipment.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the load for any individual component is less than the component load at the minimum PLR in all schemes?
output: If the load for any individual component is less than the component load at the minimum PLR the individual component model will false load or reduce duty cycle while operating at the minimum part load ratio until the load is met.

output: The 'Optimal' scheme operates each piece of equipment at its optimal part load ratio and will operate the last component between its minimum and maximum part load ratio in order to meet the loop demand.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How does the 'SequentialLoad' scheme operate in the 'Field: Condenser Water Load Distribution Scheme'?
output: The 'SequentialLoad' scheme loads each piece of equipment sequentially in the order specified in the PlantEquipmentList to its maximum part load ratio and will operate the last required piece of equipment between its minimum and maximum part load ratio in order to meet the loop demand.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How does the UniformPLR scheme distribute load among equipment?
output: UniformPLR will load all equipment on the PlantEquipmentList to a uniform part load ratio (PLR). No equipment will be loaded below its minimum PLR. If the total load is less than the sum of all equipment on the PlantEquipmentList operating at their respective minimum PLRs then the last item in the equipment list is dropped and the load is distributed based on a uniform PLR for the remaining plant equipment.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the load for any individual component is less than the component load at the minimum PLR?
output: The individual component model will false load or reduce duty cycle while operating at the minimum part load ratio until the load is met.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Load Distribution Scheme do?
output: The Load Distribution Scheme selects the algorithm used to sequence equipment operation in order to meet the plant loop demand.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How does the Optimal scheme operate equipment?
output: Optimal operates each piece of equipment at its optimal part load ratio and will operate the last component between its minimum and maximum part load ratio in order to meet the loop demand.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the SequentialLoad scheme?
output: SequentialLoad loads each piece of equipment sequentially in the order specified in the PlantEquipmentList to its maximum part load ratio and will operate the last required piece of equipment between its minimum and maximum part load ratio in order to meet the loop demand.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How does the UniformLoad scheme distribute the loop demand?
output: UniformLoad evenly distributes the loop demand among all available components on the equipment list for a given load range.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Describe the SequentialUniformPLR scheme.
output: SequentialUniformPLR loads all equipment on the PlantEquipmentList to a uniform part load ratio (PLR). Components are loaded sequentially based on the order specified in the PlantEquipmentList until each component is fully loaded at which point the next subsequent component is added and the load is distributed uniformly based on PLR between the components.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is included in the Nominal COP of the chiller?
output: This numeric field contains the chiller's coefficient of performance which should not include energy use due to pumps evap-cooled or air-cooled condenser fans or cooling tower fans. It should be at the design temperatures and water flow rates.

input: How is the priority number of the chiller used?
output: The priority number is used if Chiller Plant Operation Scheme Type is set to Default in HVACTemplate:Plant:ChilledWaterLoop. Equipment is operated in order of the priority number allowing multiple chillers to be sequenced.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Sizing Factor field allow the user to do?
output: This optional numeric field allows the user to specify a sizing factor for the component. The sizing factor is used when the component design inputs are autosized multiplying the autosizing results by the factor.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What chiller object inputs are altered by the Sizing Factor?
output: The chiller object inputs altered by the Sizing Factor are: Reference Capacity Reference Chilled Water Flow Rate and Reference Condenser Water Flow Rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the range for the Minimum Part Load Ratio?
output: The expected range is between 0 and 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What must the Minimum Part Load Ratio be in relation to the Maximum Part Load Ratio?
output: The Minimum Part Load Ratio must be less than or equal to the Maximum Part Load Ratio.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the Minimum Part Load Ratio?
output: The default value is 0.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the range for the Maximum Part Load Ratio?
output: This value may exceed 1 but the normal range is between 0.0 and 1.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What must the Maximum Part Load Ratio be in relation to the Minimum Part Load Ratio?
output: The Maximum Part Load Ratio must be greater than or equal to the Minimum Part Load Ratio.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the Maximum Part Load Ratio?
output: The default value is 1.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the Optimum Part Load Ratio?
output: This numeric field contains the chiller's optimum part-load ratio which is the ratio at which the chiller performs at its maximum COP.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What must the Optimum Part Load Ratio be in relation to the Minimum and Maximum Part Load Ratios?
output: The optimum part-load ratio must be greater than or equal to the Minimum Part Load Ratio and less than or equal to the Maximum Part Load Ratio.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the Optimum Part Load Ratio?
output: The default value is 1.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the range for the Minimum Unloading Ratio?
output: The expected range is between 0 and 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of the Minimum Unloading Ratio?
output: The minimum unloading ratio is where the chiller capacity can no longer be reduced by unloading and must be false loaded to meet smaller cooling loads. A typical false loading strategy is hot-gas bypass.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What must the Minimum Unloading Ratio be in relation to the Minimum and Maximum Part Load Ratios?
output: The minimum unloading ratio must be greater than or equal to the Minimum Part Load Ratio and less than or equal to the Maximum Part Load Ratio.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the Minimum Unloading Ratio?
output: The default value is 0.25.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Leaving Chilled Water Lower Temperature Limit field contain?
output: This numeric field contains the lower limit for the leaving chilled water temperature in Celsius acting as a cut off for heat transfer in the evaporator.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the Leaving Chilled Water Lower Temperature Limit?
output: The default value is 5˚C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the numeric field for the chiller's minimum part-load ratio contain?
output: This numeric field contains the chiller's minimum part-load ratio. The expected range is between 0 and 1. Below this part-load ratio the compressor cycles on and off to meet the cooling load. The Minimum Part Load Ratio must be less than or equal to the Maximum Part Load Ratio. The default value is 0.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the chiller's minimum part-load ratio?
output: The default value is 0.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the numeric field for the chiller's maximum part-load ratio contain?
output: This numeric field contains the chiller's maximum part-load ratio. This value may exceed 1 but the normal range is between 0.0 and 1.0. The Maximum Part Load Ratio must be greater than or equal to the Minimum Part Load Ratio. The default value is 1.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the chiller's maximum part-load ratio?
output: The default value is 1.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the numeric field for the chiller's optimum part-load ratio contain?
output: This numeric field contains the chiller's optimum part-load ratio. This is the part-load ratio at which the chiller performs at its maximum COP. The optimum part-load ratio must be greater than or equal to the Minimum Part Load Ratio and less than or equal to the Maximum Part Load Ratio. The default value is 1.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the chiller's optimum part-load ratio?
output: The default value is 1.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the numeric field for the chiller's minimum unloading ratio contain?
output: This numeric field contains the chiller's minimum unloading ratio. The expected range is between 0 and 1. The minimum unloading ratio is where the chiller capacity can no longer be reduced by unloading and must be false loaded to meet smaller cooling loads. A typical false loading strategy is hot-gas bypass. The minimum unloading ratio must be greater than or equal to the Minimum Part Load Ratio and less than or equal to the Maximum Part Load Ratio. The default value is 0.25.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the chiller's minimum unloading ratio?
output: The default value is 0.25.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the numeric field for the leaving chilled water lower temperature limit contain?
output: This numeric field contains the lower limit for the leaving chilled water temperature in Celsius. This temperature acts as a cut off for heat transfer in the evaporator so that the fluid doesn’t get too cold. The default value is 5˚C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the leaving chilled water lower temperature limit?
output: The default value is 5˚C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Field: High-Speed Nominal Capacity' contain in HVACTemplate:Plant:Tower?
output: This numeric input field contains the nominal heat rejection capacity of the cooling tower in watts under high-speed fan operation with entering water at 35C (95F) leaving water at 29.4C (85F) entering air at 25.6C (78F) wetbulb and 35C (95F) drybulb temperatures. The design water flow rate is assumed to be 5.382E-8 m³/s per watt of high-speed nominal capacity (3 gpm/ton). 125% of this nominal tower capacity gives the actual tower heat rejection at these operating conditions (based on historical assumption that the tower must dissipate 0.25W of compressor heat for every watt of heat removed by the evaporator).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Sizing Factor' field allow the user to do?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How does the 'Sizing Factor' field affect autosizing calculations?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Which tower object inputs are altered by the sizing factor?
output: The tower object inputs altered by the sizing factor are: Design Water Flow Rate Air Flow Rate at High Fan Speed Fan Power at High Fan Speed U-Factor Times Area Value at High Fan Speed Air Flow Rate at Low Fan Speed (for two-speed tower) Fan Power at Low Fan Speed (for two-speed tower) and U-Factor Times Area Value at Low.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

output: The design water flow rate is assumed to be 5.382E-8 m^3/s per watt of high-speed nominal tower capacity.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What historical assumption is made about the tower's heat rejection capacity?
output: The historical assumption is that the tower must dissipate 0.25W of compressor heat for every watt of heat removed by the evaporator.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the sizing factor field allow the user to do?
output: The sizing factor field allows the user to specify a sizing factor for the component affecting autosized design inputs.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

output: The tower object inputs affected by the sizing factor include Design Water Flow Rate Air Flow Rate at High Fan Speed Fan Power at High Fan Speed U-Factor Times Area Value at High Fan Speed Air Flow Rate at Low Fan Speed Fan Power at Low Fan Speed U-Factor Times Area Value at Low Fan Speed Air Flow Rate in Free Convection Regime and U-Factor Times Area Value at Free Convection Air Flow Rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the U-Factor Times Area Value at High Fan Speed calculated?
output: The design tower load is multiplied by the sizing factor and the design UA is then calculated as usual not the U-Factor Times Area Value itself.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

input: What should be specified in the Pump Schedule Name field if a schedule is used?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How does a constant speed pump operate when designated to run continuously?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the effect of a constant speed pump running continuously with no equipment turned on?
output: This may have the net effect of adding heat to the loop if no equipment is turned on.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How does a constant speed pump operate when it operates intermittently?
output: If the pump is constant speed and operates intermittently the pump will run at its capacity if a load is sensed and will shut off if there is no load on the loop.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the characteristics of a variable speed pump?
output: A variable speed pump is defined with maximum and minimum flow rates that are the physical limits of the device.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens when there is no load on the loop and the variable speed pump is operating intermittently?
output: If there is no load on the loop and the pump is operating intermittently then the pump can shutdown.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How does a variable speed pump operate under various conditions?
output: For any other condition such as the loop having a load and the pump is operating intermittently or the pump is continuously operating (regardless of the loading condition) the pump will operate and select a flow somewhere between the minimum and maximum limits.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What will the pump try to do when it is running?
output: In these cases where the pump is running it will try to meet the flow request made by demand side components.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the setpoint temperature when the outdoor dry-bulb temperature is at or below -6.7C?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the setpoint varied when the outdoor dry-bulb temperature is between -6.7C and 10.0C?
output: In between -6.7C and 10.0C the setpoint is varied linearly.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the constant flow option simulate?
output: The constant flow option simulates constant flow to boilers and coils with excess bypassed.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How does a constant speed pump operate?
output: The operation of a constant speed pump is fairly straightforward. If the user designates a constant speed pump that is operating continuously the pump will run regardless of whether or not there is a load.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the effect of a constant speed pump running continuously with no equipment turned on?
output: This may have the net effect of adding heat to the loop if no equipment is turned on.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if a constant speed pump operates intermittently?
output: If the pump is constant speed and operates intermittently the pump will run at its capacity if a load is sensed and will shut off if there is no load on the loop.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is a variable speed pump defined?
output: A variable speed pump is defined with maximum and minimum flow rates that are the physical limits of the device.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if there is no load on the loop and the pump is operating intermittently?
output: If there is no load on the loop and the pump is operating intermittently then the pump can shutdown.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens under conditions where the loop has a load and the pump is operating intermittently?
output: For any other condition such as the loop having a load and the pump is operating intermittently or the pump is continuously operating (regardless of the loading condition) the pump will operate and select a flow somewhere between the minimum and maximum limits.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What will a running pump try to do?
output: In these cases where the pump is running it will try to meet the flow request made by demand side components.

output: The rated head of the hot water pump is given in Pa with a default value of 179352 Pa which is equivalent to 60 feet H2O.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Load Distribution Scheme select?
output: It selects the algorithm used to sequence equipment operation to meet the plant loop demand.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the five functional Load Distribution Schemes?
output: The schemes are Optimal SequentialLoad UniformLoad SequentialUniformPLR.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Optimal Load Distribution Scheme do?
output: It operates each piece of equipment at its optimal part load ratio and will operate the last component between its minimum and maximum part load ratio to meet the loop demand.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the SequentialLoad Load Distribution Scheme do?
output: It loads each piece of equipment sequentially in the order specified in the PlantEquipmentList to its maximum part load ratio and will operate the last required piece of equipment between its minimum and maximum part load ratio to meet the loop demand.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the UniformLoad Load Distribution Scheme do?
output: It evenly distributes the loop demand among all available components on the equipment list for a given load range.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the SequentialUniformPLR Load Distribution Scheme do?
output: It loads all equipment on the PlantEquipmentList to a uniform part load ratio (PLR).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is present in the hot water loop?
output: A side bypass pipe is present in the hot water loop.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the field 'Load Distribution Scheme' contain?
output: This alpha field contains the Load Distribution Scheme Keyword.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Load Distribution Scheme select?
output: The Load Distribution Scheme selects the algorithm used to sequence equipment operation in order to meet the plant loop demand.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How many schemes are functional in the Load Distribution Scheme?
output: Currently five schemes are functional.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Optimal' scheme do?
output: The 'Optimal' scheme operates each piece of equipment at its optimal part load ratio and will operate the last component between its minimum and maximum part load ratio in order to meet the loop demand.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How does the 'SequentialLoad' scheme function?
output: The 'SequentialLoad' scheme loads each piece of equipment sequentially in the order specified in the PlantEquipmentList to its maximum part load ratio and will operate the last required piece of equipment between its minimum and maximum part load ratio in order to meet the loop demand.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the operation principle of the 'UniformLoad' scheme?
output: The 'UniformLoad' scheme evenly distributes the loop demand among all available components on the equipment list for a given load range.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How does the 'SequentialUniformPLR' scheme operate?
output: The 'SequentialUniformPLR' scheme loads all equipment on the PlantEquipmentList to a uniform part load ratio (PLR). Components are loaded sequentially based on the order specified in the PlantEquipmentList until each component is fully loaded at which point the next subsequent component is added and the load is distributed uniformly based on PLR between the components.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the 'UniformPLR' scheme's loading strategy?
output: The 'UniformPLR' scheme will load all equipment on the PlantEquipmentList to a uniform part load ratio (PLR). No equipment will be loaded below its minimum PLR. If the total load is less than the sum of all equipment on the PlantEquipmentList operating at their respective minimum PLRs then the last item in the equipment list is dropped and the load is distributed based on a uniform PLR for the remaining plant equipment.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the load for any individual component is less than the component load at the minimum PLR?
output: The individual component model will false load or reduce duty cycle while operating at the minimum part load ratio until the load is met.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> listing

output: HVACTemplate:Plant:HotWaterLoop Hot Water Loop !-Plant Loop Name  !- Pump Schedule Intermittent !- Pump Control Type Default !- Hot Water Plant Operation Scheme Type  !- Hot Water Plant Operation Scheme List Name HW Loop Temp Schedule !- Hot Water Setpoint Schedule 82 !- Hot Water Design Setpoint C VariableFlow !- Hot Water Pump Configuration 179352 !- Hot Water Pump Rated Head Pa None !- Hot Water Setpoint Reset Type 82.2 !- Hot Water Setpoint at Outdoor Dry Bulb Low C -6.7 !- Hot Water Reset Outdoor Dry Bulb Low C 65.6 !- Hot Water Setpoint at Outdoor Dry Bulb High C 10 !- Hot Water Reset Outdoor Dry Bulb High C SinglePump !- Hot Water Pump Type Yes !- Supply Side Bypass Pipe Yes !- Demand Side Bypass Pipe Water !- Fluid Type 11 !- Loop Design Delta Temperature deltaC  !- Maximum Outdoor Dry Bulb

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens when components are fully loaded in the PlantEquipmentList?
output: Components are fully loaded in the PlantEquipmentList until each component is fully loaded at which point the next subsequent component is added and the load is distributed uniformly based on PLR between the components.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does UniformPLR do in the PlantEquipmentList?
output: UniformPLR will load all equipment on the PlantEquipmentList to a uniform part load ratio (PLR).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the total load is less than the sum of all equipment operating at minimum PLRs?
output: If the total load is less than the sum of all equipment on the PlantEquipmentList operating at their respective minimum PLRs then the last item in the equipment list is dropped and the load is distributed based on a uniform PLR for the remaining plant equipment.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the load for any individual component is less than the component load at the minimum PLR?
output: If the load for any individual component is less than the component load at the minimum PLR the individual component model will false load or reduce duty cycle while operating at the minimum part load ratio until the load is met.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is described by the HVACTemplate:Plant:Boiler object?
output: A boiler or purchased heating source is described with the HVACTemplate:Plant:Boiler object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How can multiple boilers be defined?
output: Multiple boilers can be defined using multiple HVACTemplate:Plant:Boiler objects and using the Sizing Factor field to apportion the total capacity if autosizing.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of the Name field in the HVACTemplate:Plant:Boiler object?
output: The Name field is used to reference the HVACTemplate:Plant:Boiler object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the choices for the Boiler Type field in the HVACTemplate:Plant:Boiler object?
output: The choices for the Boiler Type field are DistrictHotWater (District heating) HotWaterBoiler (Hot water boiler non-condensing) and CondensingHotWaterBoiler (Hot water boiler condensing).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What equipment object types are used in the EnergyPlus for boiler plant operation schemes?
output: The EnergyPlus equipment object types used are DistrictHeatingWater and Boiler:HotWater.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Capacity field represent in the HVACTemplate:Plant:Boiler object?
output: The Capacity field may be set to autosize meaning the capacity is based on the peak loads during the design days. It contains the design heating capacity of the boiler which should be at the design water flow rates. The units are in W.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Efficiency field represent in the HVACTemplate:Plant:Boiler object?
output: The Efficiency field contains the heating efficiency (as a fraction between 0 and 1) of the boiler's burner. It is not applicable if Boiler Type is DistrictHotWater.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the choices for the Fuel Type field in the HVACTemplate:Plant:Boiler object?
output: The choices for the Fuel Type field are Electricity NaturalGas Propane FuelOilNo1 FuelOilNo2 Coal Diesel Gasoline OtherFuel1 and OtherFuel2. It is not applicable if Boiler Type is DistrictHotWater.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is described by the HVACTemplate:Plant:Boiler object?
output: A boiler or purchased heating source is described with this object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How can multiple boilers be defined in EnergyPlus?
output: To define multiple boilers use multiple HVACTemplate:Plant:Boiler objects and use the Sizing Factor field to apportion the total capacity if autosizing.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Field: Name' in the HVACTemplate:Plant:Boiler object?
output: The name used to reference the HVACTemplate:Plant:Boiler object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What options are available for the 'Field: Boiler Type'?
output: The choices for this field are: DistrictHotWater -- District heating HotWaterBoiler -- Hot water boiler (non-condensing) CondensingHotWaterBoiler -- Hot water boiler (condensing).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Which EnergyPlus equipment object types are used for user-defined boiler plant operation schemes?
output: The EnergyPlus equipment object types which are used are DistrictHeatingWater or Boiler:HotWater.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does setting the 'Field: Capacity' to autosize mean?
output: It means that the capacity is based on the peak loads during the design days.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Efficiency' represent in the HVACTemplate:Plant:Boiler object?
output: This numeric field contains the heating efficiency (as a fraction between 0 and 1) of the boiler's burner. Not applicable if Boiler Type is DistrictHotWater.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the choices for the 'Field: Fuel Type'?
output: The choices for this field are Electricity NaturalGas Propane FuelOilNo1 FuelOilNo2 Coal Diesel Gasoline OtherFuel1 OtherFuel2. Not applicable if Boiler Type is DistrictHotWater.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the 'Field: Priority' used in the HVACTemplate:Plant:Boiler object?
output: Enter the priority number of the boiler where 1 is the highest priority 2 is just lower 3 is lower than 2 etc. This is used if Boiler Plant Operation Scheme Type is set to Default in HVACTemplate:Plant:HotWaterLoop. Equipment is operated in order of the priority number. This allows multiple boilers to be sequenced.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of the 'Field: Sizing Factor'?
output: This optional numeric field allows the user to specify a sizing factor for this component. The sizing factor is used when the component design inputs are autosized: the autosizing calculations are performed as usual and the results are multiplied by the sizing factor. For this component the boiler object inputs that would be altered by the sizing factor are: Nominal Capacity and Design Water Flow Rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Minimum Part Load Ratio' specify?
output: This numeric field contains the minimum part load ratio. If the ratio of demand to boiler nominal capacity is less than the minimum part load ratio then the Min PLR will determine the operating PLR. The expected range is between 0 and 1. If this field is left blank the default value is 0.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the expected range for the 'Field: Maximum Part Load Ratio'?
output: This numeric field contains the maximum part load ratio. If the ratio of demand to boiler nominal capacity is greater than the maximum part load ratio then the Max PLR will determine the operating PLR. This value may exceed 1 but the normal range is between 0 and 1.1. If this field is left blank the default value is 1.1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Field: Optimum Part Load Ratio' indicate?
output: This numeric field contains the optimum part load ratio. This is the part load ratio at which the boiler performs at its maximum efficiency. If this field is left blank the default value is 1.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the significance of the boiler priority number in the HVAC template?
output: The boiler priority number indicates the order of operation where 1 is the highest priority 2 is lower 3 is lower than 2 etc. and is used when the Boiler Plant Operation Scheme Type is set to Default.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How does equipment operate in the HVAC template?
output: Equipment operates in order of the priority number allowing multiple boilers to be sequenced.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of the Sizing Factor field?
output: The Sizing Factor field allows the user to specify a sizing factor for the component affecting the autosizing calculations for Nominal Capacity and Design Water Flow Rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the ratio of demand to boiler nominal capacity is less than the minimum part load ratio?
output: If the ratio is less than the minimum part load ratio the Min PLR will determine the operating PLR.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the Minimum Part Load Ratio field if left blank?
output: The default value is 0.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the normal range for the Maximum Part Load Ratio?
output: The normal range is between 0 and 1.1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the Maximum Part Load Ratio field if left blank?
output: The default value is 1.1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Optimum Part Load Ratio field represent?
output: It represents the part load ratio at which the boiler performs at its maximum efficiency.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the Optimum Part Load Ratio field if left blank?
output: The default value is 1.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

Equipment is operated in order of the priority number. This allows multiple boilers to be sequenced.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be done if the water pump is always available?
output: Leave the Pump Schedule Name field blank if the water pump is always available.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should the schedule specify if a schedule name is provided for the pump?
output: Those times that the pump is available should be specified as 1.0. Those times that the pump is not available should have a zero value in the schedule specified.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Pump Control Type field specify?
output: The choices for this field are Intermittent and Continuous.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the Pump Control Type?
output: The default value is Intermittent.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When does the pump run if the control type is Continuous?
output: If the pump control type is Continuous the pump will run according to the Pump Schedule regardless of whether or not there is a load.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When does the pump run if the control type is Intermittent?
output: If the pump control type is Intermittent the pump will run if a load is sensed and will shut off if there is no load on the loop.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the choices for the Operation Scheme Type field?
output: The choices for this field are Default and UserDefined.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Default operation type do?
output: Default operation type makes all equipment available at all times operating in order of Priority specified in HVACTemplate:Plant:Boiler objects.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be done if a different scheme is to be used to sequence the boilers?
output: If a different scheme is to be used to sequence the boilers then this entry should be set to User Defined.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

output: If User Defined option is chosen then additional EnergyPlus objects must be defined in the IDF file such as PlantEquipmentOperationSchemes PlantEquipmentOperation:CoolingLoad PlantEquipmentOperation:HeatingLoad and PlantEquipmentList.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How does a constant speed pump operate if designated to run continuously?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the effect of a continuously operating constant speed pump with no equipment turned on?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How does a constant speed pump operate if designated to run intermittently?
output: If the pump is constant speed and operates intermittently the pump will run at its capacity if a load is sensed and will shut off if there is no load on the loop.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is a variable speed pump defined?

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

output: The pump will operate and select a flow somewhere between the minimum and maximum limits.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Load Distribution Scheme select?
output: The Load Distribution Scheme selects the algorithm used to sequence equipment operation in order to meet the plant loop demand.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How many schemes are functional in the Load Distribution Scheme?
output: Currently five schemes are functional.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Optimal' load distribution scheme do?
output: Optimal operates each piece of equipment at its optimal part load ratio and will operate the last component between its minimum and maximum part load ratio in order to meet the loop demand.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How does the 'SequentialLoad' scheme operate?
output: SequentialLoad loads each piece of equipment sequentially in the order specified in the PlantEquipmentList to its maximum part load ratio and will operate the last required piece of equipment between its minimum and maximum part load ratio in order to meet the loop demand.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the function of the 'UniformLoad' scheme?
output: UniformLoad evenly distributes the loop demand among all available components on the equipment list for a given load range.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How does the 'SequentialUniformPLR' scheme operate?
output: SequentialUniformPLR loads all equipment on the PlantEquipmentList to a uniform part load ratio (PLR). Components are loaded sequentially based on the order.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Demand Side Bypass Pipe' field determine?
output: The field determines if a demand side bypass pipe is present in the mixed water loop.

output: The options available are Water EthyleneGlycol30 EthyleneGlycol40 EthyleneGlycol50 EthyleneGlycol60 PropyleneGlycol30 PropyleneGlycol40 PropyleneGlycol50 and PropyleneGlycol60.

output: The temperature difference used in sizing the loop flow rate.

input: What does the 'Load Distribution Scheme' field contain?
output: This alpha field contains the Load Distribution Scheme Keyword.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Load Distribution Scheme' select?
output: The Load Distribution Scheme selects the algorithm used to sequence equipment operation in order to meet the plant loop demand.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How many schemes are functional for the 'Load Distribution Scheme'?
output: Currently five schemes are functional.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Optimal' scheme do?
output: Operates each piece of equipment at its optimal part load ratio and will operate the last component between its minimum and maximum part load ratio in order to meet the loop demand.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How does the 'SequentialLoad' scheme operate?
output: Loads each piece of equipment sequentially in the order specified in the PlantEquipmentList to its maximum part load ratio and will operate the last required piece of equipment between its minimum and maximum part load ratio in order to meet the loop demand.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the function of the 'UniformLoad' scheme?
output: Evenly distributes the loop demand among all available components on the equipment list for a given load range.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Describe the 'SequentialUniformPLR' scheme.
output: Loads all equipment on the PlantEquipmentList to a uniform part load ratio (PLR). Components are loaded sequentially based on the order specified in the PlantEquipmentList until each component is fully loaded at which point the next subsequent component is added and the load is distributed uniformly based on PLR between the components.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the 'UniformPLR' scheme?
output: Will load all equipment on the PlantEquipmentList to a uniform part load ratio (PLR). No equipment will be loaded below its minimum PLR. If the total load is less than the sum of all equipment on the PlantEquipmentList operating at their respective minimum PLRs then the last item in the equipment list is dropped and the load is distributed based on a uniform PLR for the remaining plant equipment.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the load for any individual component is less than the component load at the minimum PLR?
output: The individual component model will false load or reduce duty cycle while operating at the minimum part load ratio until the load is met.
